array7

Class Array7x7

  • java.lang.Object
    • array7.Array7x7

  • public class Array7x7
extends java.lang.Object
    The Class Array 7x7 is an extended version of the two dimensional Integer-array.
    Author:
    Philip Ekholm, Lucas Borg (shiftUp and shiftDown) Class created 2016-12-04 16:01

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Array7x7()
      Starts up Array7x7.
      Array7x7(int[][] character)
      Starts up an Array7x7 and sets character representation.

      Shifts all the bit of the representation downwards.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Array7x7

        public Array7x7(int[][] character)
        Starts up an Array7x7 and sets character representation. This constructor will be called if getChar in characters is called.
        Parameters:
        character - display character

      • Array7x7

        public Array7x7()
        Starts up Array7x7. If no representation passed as argument it will show the unknown symbol.

    • Method Detail

      • getElement

        public int getElement(int row,
                      int col)
        Simple getter for the representation-array
        Parameters:
        row - position to target in array
        col - position to target in array
        Returns:
        specific value at position

      • setElement

        public void setElement(int row,
                       int col,
                       int value)
                throws IllegalBitException
        Simple setter for the elements-array. If illegal value is passed then IllegalBitException will be thrown
        Parameters:
        row - position to target in array
        col - position to target in array
        value - value to set position to
        Throws:
        IllegalBitException

      • getRow

        public Array7 getRow(int row)
        A getter for collecting an entire Array7x7 row. Note that index starts at 0, just like normal arrays. Please access arrays using getters and setters, even internally for consistency reasons.
        Parameters:
        row - to target in array
        Returns:
        specific row at position

      • setRow

        public void setRow(int row,
                   Array7 newRowValue)
            throws IllegalBitException
        Set a whole row of the array. If an illegal value is passed then IllegalBitException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        row - to target in array, starts at 0
        newRowValue - to overwrite the row with
        Throws:
        IllegalBitException

      • getCol

        public Array7 getCol(int col)
        Get a whole column of values.
        Parameters:
        col - column to access, starts at 0
        Returns:
        Array7 of column values

        public void setCol(int col,
                   Array7 arr)
            throws IllegalBitException
        Set a whole column of values.
        Parameters:
        col - column to access, starts at 0
        arr - array to overwrite the column with
        Throws:
        IllegalBitException

      • getRepresentation

        public int[][] getRepresentation()
        Get the whole representation as int[][]
        Returns:
        representation as int[][]

      • shiftLeft

        public Array7 shiftLeft(Array7 inputCol)
        Shifts all the bit of the representation to the left.
        Parameters:
        inputCol - column to replace the column to the right with
        Returns:
        the leftmost column

      • shiftRight

        public Array7 shiftRight(Array7 inputCol)
        Shifts all the bit of the representation to the right.
        Parameters:
        inputCol - column to replace the column to the left with
        Returns:
        the rightmost column

      • shiftUp

        public Array7 shiftUp(Array7 inputRow)
        Shifts all the bit of the representation upwards.
        Parameters:
        inputRow - row to replace the row upwards with
        Returns:
        the top row

      • shiftDown

        public Array7 shiftDown(Array7 inputRow)
        Shifts all the bit of the representation downwards.
        Parameters:
        inputRow - row to replace the row downwards with
        Returns:
        the bottom row
